title: Purse, early 17th century
dimensions: H x W (excluding drawstrings): 9 x 10.5 cm (3 9/16 x 4 1/8 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri, McNeil, and General Acquisitions Endowment Funds
description: Unlined drawstring bag with two different macrame knots used to produce a diagonal grid-like pattern with diamond-shaped clusters of of tiny balls, in gold and silver metallic yarns.

tombstone.epitaph:
Purse, early 17th century.
early 17th century. Medium: metallic yarns
Technique: knotting (macramé). Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri, McNeil, and General Acquisitions Endowment Funds. 1989-30-1.
